intro: Decaloba rohrii, commonly known as the New Zealand rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while the flowers are clustered in dense heads. Decaloba rohrii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to local biodiversity.
